guides.direction: Make the macarons: In the bowl of a food processor, combine the powdered sugar, almond flour, and ½ teaspoon of salt, and process on low speed, until extra fine. Sift the almond flour mixture through a fine-mesh sieve into a large bowl.

In a separate large bowl, beat the egg whites and the remaining ½ teaspoon of salt with an electric hand mixer until soft peaks form. Gradually add the granulated sugar until fully incorporated. Continue to beat until stiff peaks form (you should be able to turn the bowl upside down without anything falling out). Add the vanilla and beat until incorporated. Add the food coloring and beat until just combined.

Add about ⅓ of the sifted almond flour mixture at a time to the beaten egg whites and use a spatula to gently fold until combined. After the last addition of almond flour, continue to fold slowly until the batter falls into ribbons and you can make a figure 8 while holding the spatula up. Transfer the macaron batter into a piping bag fitted with a round tip.

Make the buttercream: In a large bowl, add the butter and beat with a mixer for 1 minute until light and fluffy. Sift in the powdered sugar and beat until fully incorporated. Add the vanilla and beat to combine. Add the cream, 1 tablespoon at a time, and beat to combine, until desired consistency is reached.
Take the Bowl you most like and add the 250g Cereal.
Add into your Bowl of Cereal your Nuts and Fruits. After adding it pour in the Milk.
Rasp the Chocolate on Top of your Cereal Bowl mixture and Glaze it with Honey.
Take the 700ml Glass and it has to be a Fancy Glass. The Fancy Glass is IMPORTANT. Pour in the 500ml Milk and afterwards the 80g Chocolate Powder. Stirr it till completly mixed.

Take your Rasper, if not available then chop the Chocolate in fine peaces. Start rasping the Chocolate on your Smoothie. If you chopped the Chocolate then sprinklen them on top of your Smoothie. Repeat this process as much as you like.

Put the flour in a bowl and make a well. Mix 5 tablespoons of warm milk, 1 pinch of sugar and crumbled yeast and pour into the well. Sprinkle a little flour on top and let rise, covered, in a warm place for about 10 minutes.

guides.step: Mixing other Components in the Flour Mixture
guides.direction: Add egg yolk, butter, salt, remaining milk and sugar to the pre-dough. Knead everything into a smooth dough. Cover and let rise in a warm place for about 1 hour until the dough has doubled in volume.
Knead dough with hands and roll out on a little flour about ½ cm thick. With a round cookie cutter (Ø about 7 cm) cut out taler. Cover and let rise in a warm place for about 20 minutes.

Heat the fat in a pot to about 170 degrees. The temperature is important when small bubbles rise from a wooden spoon dipped on the bottom of the pot. Put the dough in portions, put the lid on the pot and fry the dough for about 2 minutes. Turn, fry for another minute or so.
Lift doughnuts out of fat with a slotted spoon and let cool on a cooling rack.
Place rose hip pulp in a piping bag with a small long nozzle (Ø 0.5 cm). Fill doughnuts. Dust with powdered sugar.

ingredients: 1 or 2 cloves garlic, peeled and minced
guides.direction: In a bowl, mix ground beef, egg, onion, bread crumbs, Worcestershire, garlic, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper until well blended. Divide mixture into four equal portions and shape each into a patty about 4 inches wide.

Lay burgers on an oiled barbecue grill over a solid bed of hot coals or high heat on a gas grill (you can hold your hand at grill level only 2 to 3 seconds); close lid on gas grill. Cook burgers, turning once, until browned on both sides and no longer pink inside (cut to test), 7 to 8 minutes total. Remove from grill.
Lay buns, cut side down, on grill and cook until lightly toasted, 30 seconds to 1 minute.
Spread mayonnaise and ketchup on bun bottoms. Add lettuce, tomato, burger, onion, and salt and pepper to taste. Set bun tops in place.

Add the oil in the Pan and heat it. Add the minced Garlic with a bit Rosemary and after the Garlic is getting brownish add the Onion. When the caramelization starts add the Tomato. Spice it up with a pinch of Salt.
Take your Steak and on each Site(front and back) add Salt and Pepper. If the Steak is a wider than 2cm, then Salt and Pepper the sides.

Preheat the Pan with a little bit of oil. The Pan and the oil has to be really hot. Add your prepared Steak and after 1 turn each side add the crushed Garlic and the Rosemary with 2 Tablespoon of Butter. Take a tablespoon and lift the Pan in an angle. Through the Butter mixture on top of the Steak.
Place the fryed veggies on one side and the Steak to the other side. Dont Cut the Steak until 2 to 5 minutes passed. The Rest Time depends on the thickness of the Steak.
